text: it's difficult taken care to disabled
people it is difficult my name is diane
romano i live with my mom virginia
buckles and my brother John backhauls
about a year ago I saw our bills loan
paid her cable was off and for my doctor
hok as soon as you saw I immediately
said she's got out sorry miss my brother
has traumatic brain injury as a child he
fell out a window he was paralyzed
totally paralyzed for years you know I'm
not going to abandon them I mean I'm
sick myself but I am able to take care
of them I met my daughter every morning
in the Trade Center on that day I didn't
meet her I didn't know she was alive or
dead and i thought it was the end of the
world I took one big fall I've had
surgery on my back my neck I've had
physical therapy I've had everything I
guess you could say I'm a fighter and I
try to overcome everything but I really
felt desperate i really thought how am I
gonna take care of these two people we
actually were baked it it had to go live
with my daughter in the city she's got a
studio so picture wall of us there you
know I knew I was going to need some
assistance somehow the JCC come up and
that's of aura she got me the
appointment here I go this to get the
assistance for the rent and then the
moving
I mean I could smile again I wasn't
smiling and I like to smile it means we
can live we can survive we can be happy
together
